page.title: 14Then & Now- life in 1925 (2)
page.content: boots and a pinny round their waist always whether they were dressed for work or anything else and always a shawl around their shoulders and straw hats and that. A person would be considered old at 60. {What was your hair like? Similar to what it is now, short straight we didn't have perms we didn't go to a hairdresser or what they do today have it dyed etc. No it was just ordinary unless we were going to a dance and then we'd get out our big curlers and we'd stick them into Mother's fire and get them hot and to make sure they weren't too hot we'd have a piece of brown paper and if it singed the paper it was too hot. We never spent no money on going to the hairdresser's, couldn't afford it. {Did you wear glasses, and where would {they come from? }
